result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Richard Margetta Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: * Restitution payable to SEAN B for THREE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY DOLLARS ($380.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  UNLESS PREVIOUSLY PAID. 
* The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
with credit for TWO HUNDRED AND FORTY-SIX DAYS (246) DAYS time served

superMiscConds.notes: * Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING, commencing AUGUST 24, 2016, received and filed. (32 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to OTHER.

Defendant Aaron Richard Margetta in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Aaron Richard Margetta in custody.  Dave T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  AARON M (JR).

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THREE (3) YEARS, with credit for TWO HUNDRED AND FORTY-SIX DAYS (246) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE (1) YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Restitution payable to SEAN B for THREE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY DOLLARS ($380.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  UNLESS PREVIOUSLY PAID.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Aaron Richard Margetta in court with attorney Deb Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

  The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
